availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
Oath of Allegiance.
W. Reid Gould, Successor to Jansen & Bell, 158 Nassau-St, N. Y.

I, Joseph B. Nones of the City Couty & State of New York do solemnly Swear that I will support, protect and defend the Constitution and Government of the United States against all enemies, whether domestic or foreign, and that I will bear True Faith, Allegiance, and Loyality to the same, any ordinance, Resolution, or Law of any State Convention or Legislature to the contrary notwithstanding; and, further, that I do this with a full determination, pledge, and purpose, without any mental reservation or evasion whatsoever; and further, that I will well and faithfully perform all the duties which may be required of me by Law: So help me God.
Sworn to and subscribed before me this Eigteenth day of October 1865

figure.ab:
EDWARD CHACE
NOTARY PUBLIC
NEW - YORK

body.p:
Edward Chace
Notary Public N Y.

United States of America.
State of New York
City & County of new York } ss.

I Joseph B. Nones, of the City of New York aforesaid, having been appointed & Commissioned, on the 13th day of October 1865 -- by His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette Governor of the State of Kentucky -- as a Commissioner of deeds for such State, in New York aforesaid, -- Do Solemnly swear that, I will honestly, faithfully and impartially discharge & perform all the duties incumbent upon ^me^ by Virtue of such appointment, according to law, -- without fear or favor==So help me God.
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 18th day of October 1865.

figure.ab:
EDWARD CHACE
NOTARY PUBLIC
NEW - YORK

body.p:
Edward Chace
Notary Public N Y.

figure.ab:
JOSEPH B. NONES
OF KENTUCKY FOR NEW YORK
COMMISSIONER

body.p: Signature, & copy of the Official Seal of the above named Comms J. B. Nones.

J. B. Nones.
Commr of Kentucky In New York

Comr of Deeds
New York
Oath of Jos B. Nones
filed 23d Oct 1865
